title: The Fallacy Detective: Thirty-Six Lessons on How to Recognize Bad Reasoning, 2nd Edition
description: What is a fallacy? A fallacy is an error in logic a place where someone has made a mistake in his thinking. A cloud is 90% water. A watermelon is 90% water. Therefore, since a plane can fly through a cloud, a plane can fly through a watermelon. This book meets the needs of parents who want a do-able text for introducing logic and critical thinking to their children. -Fun to use -- not dry like a math textbook. -Self-teaching -- not intimidating, starts students with skills they can use right away. -Each lesson has exercises for students, with an answer key at the back. -Covers logical fallacies and propaganda techniques. -Geared for ages twelve and older. -Includes cartoons to illustrate the logical fallacies discussed, including Peanuts, Dilbert, Calvin and Hobbes.
author: Nathaniel Bluedorn
